Title: Attempted coup’ in Benin Republic as soldiers announce President Talon’s removal
Summary: President Patrice Talon is due to step down next April after 10 years in power . Soldiers calling themselves the “Military Committee for Refoundation” (CMR), said they had ousted President Talon .

Title: Gov Eno offers ₦100m studio, land to visually impaired singer
Summary: Governor Umo Eno has offered visually-impaired gospel musician Chris Vic, a plot of land, ₦100 million to set up his music studio . Eno disclosed this on Sunday morning via a post on Facebook .

Title: Police nab security guard over murder of retired Delta judge
Summary: Police nab security guard over murder of retired Delta judge . Justice Ifeoma Okogwu was a High Court judge in the state . Police nabed a key suspect in the murder of the judge .

Title: FCT Council Election: Immigration Chief seeks collaboration with INEC
Summary: Comptroller of the Immigration Service (CIS), FCT, Madam Sharifat Ronke Ibrahim, has advocated for stronger collaboration with INEC to ensure greater security during the forthcoming 2026 FCT Area Council Election .

Title: Messi dazzles as Miami beat Vancouver to win MLS title
Summary: Lionel Messi inspires Inter Miami to their first-ever MLS Cup title . Argentina superstar Messi provided assists for two goals and helped create another . Inter Miami beat Vancouver Whitecaps 3-1 to win MLS Cup in Florida .

Title: Shots heard in Cotonou after Benin coup attempt, Presidency insists in control
Summary: Witnesses reported hearing the sound of gunfire in Benin's economic capital Cotonou . Military group announced that they had ousted President Patrice Talon on Sunday . The Presidency insists in control of the situation .

Title: Nigeria deserves transparent institutions, leaders who strengthen public trust – ACF youths
Summary: The Arewa Consultative Forum Youth Movement (ACFYM) said Nigeria deserves institutions built on transparency and leaders whose actions strengthen not undermine public trust . President of the movement, Kabiru Yusuf said this in Abuja, yesterday .

Title: FG begins recovery of 157 model Almajiri schools
Summary: The Federal Government has commenced full recovery of 157 model Almajiri Schools built across the country under the Administration of former President Goodluck Jonathan .

Title: Awujale Stool: Prove your royal lineage – Ruling house tells KWAM 1
Summary: The Chairman of the ruling house stated that only bonafide members of the family would be allowed to participate in the selection process . The Chairman said that only .bonafide . members of . the family will be allowed . to participate . in the process .

Title: Troops rescue 14 kidnap victims in Enugu – Benue border forest
Summary: Troops rescued 14 kidnapped victims during clearance operation in Orokam Forest, Benue State . The forest shares common border with Udenu Local Government Area of Enugu State . A reliable military source said the victims were abducted over the weekend .

Title: FULL LIST: African coups in the last five years
Summary: A group of soldiers announced that they had ousted President Patrice Talon, although his entourage said he was safe and the army was regaining control . Here is a recap of the successful coups on the continent over the last five years: The Malian military took over from civilian leaders of an interim government .

Title: Doctors demand security, better pay to curb brain drain
Summary: The National Executive Council of the National Association of Government General Medical and Dental Practitioners has called for urgent reforms to salvage Nigeria’s struggling healthcare system . The National President of the association, Dr Anas Idris, stated this on Sunday in Abeokuta as part of a communique issued by the NEC following the one

Title: APC reschedules national caucus, NEC meetings
Summary: The meetings, originally scheduled for December 15–16, 2025, have been shifted to December 18–19, the party said . The adjustment was communicated in an official notice titled “Change of Meeting Dates’, issued by the party’s National Secretary, Senator Surajudeen Basiru, and shared on his X

Title: NDLEA seizes 7.6m tramadol pills, 76,273kg cannabis in Delta, others
Summary: The National Drug Law Enforcement Agency has seized more than 7.6 million pills of tramadol and over 76,273.4 kilograms of various strains of cannabis . The agency also arrested several suspects linked to the drug trafficking networks behind the consignments .

Title: PDP chieftain urges Northern leaders to take responsibility for insecurity
Summary: Gbenga Olawepo-Hashim is a former presidential candidate and founding member of the Peoples Democratic Party . He has urged Northern political, traditional, and social elites to take responsibility for what he described as the region’s escalating security collapse . He also welcomed the appointment of General Christopher Musa (retd.)
